channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Miami mayor calls for Trump to 'immediately' reinstate TPS for Venezuelans
item.description: Higgins said the Trump administration ending TPS for Venezuelans in early 2025 was "reckless, dangerous, and wrong."
item.content:encoded:
Higgins said the Trump administration ending TPS for Venezuelans in early 2025 was "reckless, dangerous, and wrong."

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Nicolás Maduro will appear in U.S. federal court on Monday
item.description: The Venezuelan president, who was captured by U.S. forces early Saturday, is awaiting trial in New York City on federal criminal charges.
item.content:encoded:
The Venezuelan president, who was captured by U.S. forces early Saturday, is awaiting trial in New York City on federal criminal charges.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Rubio says there's 'not a war against Venezuela' despite U.S. capture of Maduro
item.description: Top Democrat calls operation 'a violation of the law' and promises Senate vote on President Trump's war powers.
item.content:encoded:
Top Democrat calls operation 'a violation of the law' and promises Senate vote on President Trump's war powers.

(Image credit: Molly Riley)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Denmark's prime minister says 'stop the threats' of U.S. annexing Greenland
item.description: The wife of Trump's deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller posted a photo implying a U.S. takeover of Greenland, hours after the U.S. attacks on Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
The wife of Trump's deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller posted a photo implying a U.S. takeover of Greenland, hours after the U.S. attacks on Venezuela.

(Image credit: John Thys)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: Wellness trends worth taking into the new year (and some that aren't)
item.description: We reported on all sorts of products and practices promising to make you healthy last year. Here are the ones that stood up to science, and those that were mostly hype.
item.content:encoded: We reported on all sorts of products and practices promising to make you healthy last year. Here are the ones that stood up to science, and those that were mostly hype.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Muraskin

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: New newsmakers of 2025
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with KNPR listener Calvin Siemer of Henderson, Nev., and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with KNPR listener Calvin Siemer of Henderson, Nev., and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: Trump tried to bury evidence of the Jan. 6 riot. NPR's archive preserves the facts
item.description: NPR's Jan. 6 archive brings together reporting, video, documents and testimony to show what really happened during the Capitol riot. Explore the timeline, cases and evidence behind the attack.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Jan. 6 archive brings together reporting, video, documents and testimony to show what really happened during the Capitol riot. Explore the timeline, cases and evidence behind the attack.
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: A tale of two U.S. interventions and why Venezuela is not Panama 2.0
item.description: Operation Absolute Resolve, that resulted in the capture of Nicolás Maduro, echoes the 1990 U.S. invasion of Panama that brought down Manuel Noriega. But big differences abound.
item.content:encoded:
Operation Absolute Resolve, that resulted in the capture of Nicolás Maduro, echoes the 1990 U.S. invasion of Panama that brought down Manuel Noriega. But big differences abound.

(Image credit: Federico Parra)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Trump wants U.S. oil companies in Venezuela. Here's what to know
item.description: President Trump wants more U.S. oil companies to "go in" to Venezuela. But there are economic, historical, and climate reasons that may not be easy. Here's what you need to know about oil in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump wants more U.S. oil companies to "go in" to Venezuela. But there are economic, historical, and climate reasons that may not be easy. Here's what you need to know about oil in Venezuela.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: Venezuela opposition in limbo as the world wonders who is in charge
item.description: President Trump said the United States would "run" Venezuela. But interim President Delcy Rodríguez denounced the U.S. operation and rejected the idea of U.S. control.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said the United States would "run" Venezuela. But interim President Delcy Rodríguez denounced the U.S. operation and rejected the idea of U.S. control.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths
